result.execSummary:
The defendant Omarshire M Randolph was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) to be taken from the $600.00 cash bail on deposit.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 12 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.
*Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition with prejudice.
Return of property hearing on July 25, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Bail refund packet. vp
Bail Notice mailed to surety on 05/23/17.  vp

Defendant Omarshire M Randolph in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 12 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) to be taken from the $600.00 cash bail on deposit.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Positive drug test with valid prescription.  No action taken by the court at this time.

Arguments heard as to bail conditions. Court grants defendant's motion to modify JusticePoint supervision. Defendant previously turned over for INTENSIVE supervision. Court ordered supervision level lowered to ENHANCED supervision. 
All other conditions remain. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Omarshire M Randolph in court. Attorney Dennis Thorton is unavailable for today's proceedings.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjournment for reasons presented to the Court off the record. Case is adourned for Sentencing, Branch 47. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Omarshire M Randolph in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was calendared for Final Pretrial.     
for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
